details.title: A Test of the Effect of Satellite Spin on Two-Way Doppler Range-Rate Measurements
details.abstract: Analysis indicates that the rotation of a satellite can cause an error in the range-rate measurements of a two-way Doppler tracking system. The error is proportional to the rotation rate, and the constant of proportionality depends on the polarization of the satellite transponder antennas. Measurements made by ground-based simulation confirmed the analytical prediction.
details.journal_title: IEEE Transactions on Aerospace and Electronic Systems
